results.title: Flare of the sun
results.brief_description: New Zealand’s contribution to the International Geophysical Year, 1957-1958, as exemplified in the tracking of sunspots and the consequent interruptions to radio signals. The extent of New Zealand’s observations; routine work at stations from Antarctica to the Pacific; the elaborate international communications system for tracing a sunspot and warning radio channels. A picture of scientific cooperation on an international scale.

results.title: Flank Breeder
results.brief_description: The myopic Flank Breeder trundles through life filling a small home with small deeds. The world at large is of no consequence…until the accident. A pedestrian duck lays stricken on Flank Breeder’s doorstep. A time has come for action, to quickly lend a hand, but so imprinted is Flank by a small world and its demands, that he finds himself unable to rise to the situation. Script and animation by Bruce Currie.

results.title: Flaming star
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and David Weisbart
results.brief_description: Considered one of Elvis Presley’s most dramatic roles, “Flaming Star” is a story about Pacer Burton’s (Presley) struggle as a young man torn between two cultures. Set some years after the Civil War, the small community that Pacer lives in finds itself under siege from the Kiowa tribe. After several settlers are killed the community turns on Pacer and his family and Pacer is forced to choose between the community he grew up in and his Native American roots. His choice leads to tragedy for both sides. “Flaming Star” enables Presley to showcase his acting ability without the usual musical intermissions. Cast also includes Dolores Del Rio, John McIntire and Barbara Eden. Features the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Flamenco at 5.15
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Cynthia Scott, Adam Symansky and Kathleen Shannon
results.brief_description: FLAMENCO AT 5.15 is a visual and emotional thriller. It is an impressionistic record of a flamenco dance class given to senior students of the National Ballet School of Canada by two great teachers from Spain, Susana and Antonio Robledo. The film shows the beautiful young North American dancers inspired by the flamenco rhythms and mesmerised by Susana’s extraordinary energy, joyously merging with an ancient gypsy culture. (Awards: Academy Award, Hollywood; Salerno; San Francisco; Cracow; Valladolid; Yorkton; New York)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Cynthia Scott, Adam Symansky and Kathleen Shannon

results.title: Flamenco [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Juan Lebron Producciones, Radio Television de Andalucia (RTVA), Sogepaq, Canal+, Juan Lebron and Carlos Saura
results.brief_description: This Spanish documentary is a tribute to flamenco dancing, singing, guitar playing and music, presented in all its glorious pageantry, passion and colour. Carlos Saura amasses an impressive range of artists, over 300, who sing, dance and play music, expressing stories with fervour, dignity and evident respect for the tradition of flamenco art. With little dialogue, narratives are expressed through rumba, tango, ballet, taranta, song and music, in a variety of moods and styles, often in small collaborations but also in groups of twenty or more. A minimalist setting, the old Plaza de Armas train station in Seville, is transformed into an impromptu space, beautifully photographed with dramatic lighting highlighting the sense of theatre, drawing attention to expressive performances. These performers, who vary in age from children to the elderly, give an extraordinary recital, which embraces and celebrates culture. Includes: Paco de Lucia, Manolo Sanlucar, Lole Manuel, Jose Menese, Jose Merce, Mario Maya, Belen Maya, Carmen Linares, Manolo Sanlucar, Maria Pages, Joaquin Cortes, Juana la del Revuelo, Matilde Coral, Enrique Morente, Aurora Vargas, La Paquera de Jerez, Paco Toronjo, Paco de Lucia, Fernanda de Utrera, Merche Esmeralda, Remedies Amaya, Moratio Chico, Nino Jero and Paco del Gastor. Please note, singing is in Spanish with no subtitles.

results.title: Flags = Zastave
results.creator_credit: Neoplanta Film, Nancy Karkowsky and Zoran Jovanovic
results.brief_description: Zoran Jovanovic, in simple line drawings, explores man’s complex relationship to one of his most important symbols - the flag. Only women, Jovanovic implies, see the flag not as symbol but as fabric. Animation by Predrag Pantovic and Slavomir Calic.

results.title: Five, four, three, two, one birds away
results.brief_description: In a simulated attack by a Jindivik unmanned target aircraft, the destroyer H.M.A.S. Hobart demonstrates its new electronic detection and defence systems, firing a Tarter guided missile. Part of the Navy in Focus series.

results.title: Five towns
results.creator_credit: Green Park Productions and Terry Bishop
results.brief_description: The pottery industry seen though the eyes of a young London girl marrying into a typical potteries family. The film tells of the life of the people in the potteries and of the great industry in which they work. It shows ways in which conditions of work are in process of being modernised. Factory sequences were shot at the Crown Staffordshire Pottery, Fenton and the Wedgwood Pottery.

results.title: Five times dizzy. - Episodes 7-12.
results.creator_credit: Samson Film Services, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Tom Jeffrey and John Eastway
results.brief_description: The final three episodes in the dramatisation of Nadia Wheatley’s award winning book about a family of Greek immigrants in Sydney’s Newtown, their homesick grandmother and the inhabitants of the street in which they live, as seen through the eyes of Mareka, the young daughter.

results.title: Five times dizzy. - Episodes 1-6.
results.creator_credit: Samson Film Services, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Tom Jeffrey and John Eastway
results.brief_description: The first three episodes in a dramatisation of Nadia Wheatley’s award winning book. Mareka would be quite happy in the milk bar in Newtown, even though it is so far from Greece, if it wasn’t for the Wilson kids giving her a hard time. But her Yaya, her grandmother, has only recently arrived in Australia and feels lost and unhappy. If only Mareka could find her Yaya something to do. Then she has an idea. But it’s such a big idea she feels dizzy.
